title: OpenDrawer Metadata Tier 5 - Measures and Instrumen

Name of the instrument or scale used (e..description: One-sentence description of how the construct was operationalized in the study.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-studyid: The stable, unique identifier for a study that never changes, even if other study metadata changes (like the study name, short name, owner, or project). Example: STUDY_SCA
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-optional-persistent-row-identifier: Use studyID as the anchor, plus a persistent row identifier to identify a specific file/version, etc.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-optional-persistent-row-identifier-val: Enter a unique identifier for the selection made.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-optional-appliesto: Indicates the level of entity to which a metadata value applies (e.g., individual participant or population summary).
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-optional-aggregationlevel: Specifies whether a metadata value represents individual-level data or an aggregate summary
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-optional-populationscope: Identifies the population described by the metadata (e.g., study-wide, cohort, or study arm).
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-devicetype: The type of digital device used for data collection, applicable only when data are collected digitally.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-softwareplatform: The software environment or application used to deliver, collect, or manage digitally collected data.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-inputmethod: The primary method by which participant input or data capture occurs during digital data collection.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-administrationmode: The manner in which a digital assessment or data collection activity is administered to participants.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-manufacturermodel: Device make/model. Valid values: free text OR Multiple, Varies, Unknown.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-operatingsystem: OS and version. Valid values: free text OR Multiple, Varies, Unknown.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-appplatform: App or platform used. Valid values: free text OR Multiple, Varies, Unknown.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-sensors: Sensors enabled (GPS, accelerometer, etc.). Valid values: free text OR Multiple, Varies, Unknown.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-measuredconstruct: A conceptual domain or construct that a study collected data on (e.g., depression, working memory, physical activity).
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-measuretype: The general type of measure used to assess a construct.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-isvalidatedmeasure: Indicates whether a measure or instrument used to assess a construct has been previously validated.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-measuredescription: A brief description of how a measure was administered and what it was designed to assess.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-if-not-provided-as-a-row-identifier-in: a stable identifier used to reference a specific instrument, measure, or assessment used in a study (e.g., a validated questionnaire, cognitive task, interview protocol, or sensor-based assessment).
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-instrumentcitation: The primary citation(s) describing the instrument/task implementation used in the study (e.g., published paper, manual, DOI).
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-instrumentversion: Version identifier for the instrument implementation used (e.g., vendor version, protocol revision, “v2”, “2016 revision”).
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-stimulusresponsemode: How participants interacted with the instrument during administration.
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-administrationinstructions: The instructions provided to participants describing exactly how to perform the instrument/task (verbatim or summarized).
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-administrationprocedure: The source of the implementation (e.g., NIH Toolbox, PEBL, PsychoPy script, custom app).
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-protocoldescription: The synID of the wiki that contains the protocol, study design and goals
Name of the instrument or scale used (e..x-protocolurl: Link to the protocol, manual, script, or documentation describing the instrument implementation.
